channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Barry’s cofounder meets with ‘random’ young people who send him cold emails and LinkedIn DMs—it’s how he hired the current CEO

item.title: What to Know About M.L.K. Day
item.description: Since 1986, a federal holiday on the third Monday of January has celebrated the legacy of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Construction firm Italian-Thai Development is under fire after consecutive crane collapses
item.description: Italian-Thai Development, No. 174 on the Southeast Asia 500, is also linked to last year's collapse of a partially-built skyscraper in Bangkok.

item.title: Stocks sell off globally as traders digest Trump message saying he wants Greenland because ‘your Country decided not to give me the Nobel’

item.title: Survivors of Deadly Train Crash in Spain Describe Hellish Scenes
item.description: Photographs show a tangled mess of metal, wires and broken glass at the scene of the crash, which killed at least 39 people.

item.title: Trump’s New Greenland Threat Outrages Allies, and China’s Birthrate Plunges

item.title: Sanae Takaichi, Japan’s Prime Minister, Calls for Snap Election
item.description: Sanae Takaichi, the first woman to be Japan’s prime minister, is hoping to seize on her popularity by calling a parliamentary election next month.

item.title: Syria, in Ruins
item.description: A year after the dictator fell, Syrians are returning to a country with no clear plan for rebuilding.
